name: IBPS PO (Probationary Officer)
description: A Common Written Examination (CWE) conducted annually by the Institute of Banking Personnel Selection (IBPS) for the recruitment of Probationary Officers (PO) / Management Trainees (MT) in various Public Sector Banks in India.

eligibility.ageLimit: 20 to 30 years. Age relaxation is applicable for reserved categories as per government norms.
eligibility.educationalQualification: A Degree (Graduation) in any discipline from a University recognised by the Govt. Of India. The candidate must possess a valid Mark-sheet / Degree Certificate.
eligibility.nationality: A Citizen of India or a subject of Nepal or Bhutan, or a Tibetan Refugee who came over to India before 1st January 1962 with the intention of permanently settling in India.

timeline.notificationDate: Expected in August 2024 (For 2023, it was August 1, 2023)
timeline.examDate: Prelims: October 19 & 20, 2024. Mains: November 30, 2024 (As per IBPS Calendar 2024-25)
timeline.resultDate: Final allotment result is declared on April 1 of the following year.

stages.name: Stage 1: Preliminary Examination
stages.description: An online objective test of 100 marks with a duration of 1 hour (60 minutes), comprising 3 sections with individual timings. This stage is qualifying in nature.

stages.name: Stage 2: Main Examination
stages.description: Consists of an Online Objective Test (200 marks) and an Online Descriptive Test (25 marks). Both are conducted on the same day. Marks from both are considered for shortlisting for the interview.

stages.name: Stage 3: Interview
stages.description: Candidates who clear the Main exam are called for an in-person interview conducted by the participating banks and coordinated by the nodal bank in each state/UT. The interview carries 100 marks.

examPattern.markingScheme: For objective tests (Prelims and Mains), 1/4th (or 0.25) of the marks assigned to a question will be deducted for each wrong answer. The descriptive paper is evaluated manually.

syllabus.name: Main Exam: Data Analysis & Interpretation
topics: Advanced Data Interpretation (Tabular, Bar, Line, Pie, Caselet)
